(45) 126.%rd August, 1945./4 copy No. 1 *)CABINET.MONETARY AWARDS.Note by the Prime Minister.AT the end of the last war, monetary grants totalling 585,000 were made byParliament to the Military Chiefs (see list annexed). The question whether such grants should be made at the end of this war was raised in Parliament onthe 15th May last, when Major Lloyd asked the then Prime Minister whetherit was intended to invite Parliament in the near future to express the Nation'sgratitude to our principal Service leaders, and to make a monetary grant. the reply given was '' So far as the ' near future' is concerned, the answer is inthe negative."2. The matter of principle is one which should be settled by the Cabinet.C.R. A.10, Downing Street, S.W. 1,23rd August, 1945.[p.t.o.
